oai_dc:dc.dc:title: Relativistic decoherence: Efficient numerical simulations of spin 1/2 relativistic open quantum systems
oai_dc:dc.dc:creator: Cabrera, Renan
Bondar, Denys I.
Campos, Andre G.
Rabitz, Herschel A.
oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: Quantum Physics
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: We present a flexible ab initio approach for simulating spin 1/2 relativistic open quantum systems undergoing decoherence as well as interaction with an external electromagnetic field. The methodology is illustrated on a variety of examples. We generally find that decoherence does not suppress particle-antiparticle production, whereas it can eliminate zitterbewegung. Our computational approach makes accessible open relativistic simulations previously thought to be prohibitively expensive.
